    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add​(RoutingTable.Route r)
        Adds a route to the table if it not exist already.
        Parameters:
        r - Route

      • add

        public void add​(RouteX routeX)
        Adds a new Rout, based on a RouteX object. Takes the routeX's source and routeX's and tokenizedHeader's origin as values.
        Parameters:
        routeX - RouteX

      • drop

        public void drop()
        Drops the whole list as creates a new List. Stores the empty list immediately and overrides old records.

      • getNextForDestination

        public java.lang.String getNextForDestination​(java.lang.String destAddr)
        Checks if there is a route for a given destination address.
        Parameters:
        destAddr - Destination address, which will be searched for a route
        Returns:
        Returns the nearest and best routes "neighbour" variable. (Check class Route for more information). Returns "no_next", if there was no route found for this destination.

        public static RoutingTable getInstance()
        Must run restore in first contact with this object.

        RoutingTable instance

        Persists the RouteList

      • restore

        public void restore​(java.lang.String owner)
        Restores the RouteList for a specific owner.
        Parameters:
        owner - The owner represents the nodes address.

      • removeRoute

        public void removeRoute​(java.lang.String destination)
        Removes all nodes which contains this destination
        Parameters:
        destination - Removes routes for destination address

      • hasRoute

        public boolean hasRoute​(java.lang.String destination)
        Proofs if there is any route for this destination
        Parameters:
        destination - Destinations address
        Returns:
        true if any route was found, false if no route was found

      • hasRoute

        public boolean hasRoute​(RoutingTable.Route route)
        Proofs if there is any route for this destination See hasRoute(String destination) for more information
        Parameters:
        route - Proofs if a route for the destination of the Routes object address exists
        Returns:
        true if has found any route
